stem: A patient with systemic vasculitis develops acute foot drop and numbness over the dorsum of the foot. Which nerve is most likely affected at the fibular neck?
rationale_correct: Foot drop with dorsum sensory loss localizes to common peroneal nerve injury at the fibular neck.

rationale_distractors.B: Tibial nerve lesions cause plantarflexion weakness and sole sensory loss.
rationale_distractors.C: Femoral lesions impair knee extension/anterior thigh sensation, not foot dorsum.
rationale_distractors.D: Obturator lesions affect medial thigh adduction and sensation.
rationale_distractors.E: Saphenous is sensory only to medial leg/foot; foot drop would not occur.
